  • The ID in the id query parameter is not valid.
  • The format of the date and time in the start_time field is not valid.
  • The value in the timezone field is not valid.
  • The value in the duration field is not valid.
  • The ID in the category_id field is not valid.
  • The string in the title field is too long.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:schedule scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.
response_codes.404: • The specified broadcast segment was not found.

name: Create Channel Stream Schedule Segment
description: Adds a single or recurring broadcast to the broadcaster’s streaming schedule.
instruction: Adds a single or recurring broadcast to the broadcaster’s streaming schedule. For information about scheduling broadcasts, see Stream Schedule.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:schedule scope.

start_time.instruction: The date and time that the broadcast segment starts. Specify the date and time in RFC3339 format (for example, 2021-07-01T18:00:00Z).

timezone.instruction: The time zone where the broadcast takes place. Specify the time zone using IANA time zone database format (for example, America/New_York).

duration.instruction: The length of time, in minutes, that the broadcast is scheduled to run. The duration must be in the range 30 through 1380 (23 hours).

is_recurring.instruction: A Boolean value that determines whether the broadcast recurs weekly. Is true if the broadcast recurs weekly. Only partners and affiliates may add non-recurring broadcasts.

category_id.instruction: The ID of the category that best represents the broadcast’s content. To get the category ID, use the Search Categories endpoint.

title.instruction: The broadcast’s title. The title may contain a maximum of 140 characters.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the schedule to add the broadcast segment to. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

data.instruction: The broadcaster’s streaming scheduled.

segments.instruction: A list that contains the single broadcast segment that you added.

name: Update Channel Stream Schedule
description: Updates the broadcaster’s schedule settings, such as scheduling a vacation.
instruction: Updates the broadcaster’s schedule settings, such as scheduling a vacation.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:schedule scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose schedule settings you want to update. The ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

is_vacation_enabled.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether the broadcaster has scheduled a vacation. Set to true to enable Vacation Mode and add vacation dates, or false to cancel a previously scheduled vacation.

vacation_start_time.instruction: The UTC date and time of when the broadcaster’s vacation starts. Specify the date and time in RFC3339 format (for example, 2021-05-16T00:00:00Z). Required if is_vacation_enabled is true.

vacation_end_time.instruction: The UTC date and time of when the broadcaster’s vacation ends. Specify the date and time in RFC3339 format (for example, 2021-05-30T23:59:59Z). Required if is_vacation_enabled is true.

timezone.instruction: The time zone that the broadcaster broadcasts from. Specify the time zone using IANA time zone database format (for example, America/New_York). Required if is_vacation_enabled is true.

response_codes.204: Successfully updated the broadcaster’s schedule settings.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
  • The format of the string in vacation_start_time is not valid.
  • The format of the string in vacation_end_time is not valid.
  • The date in vacation_end_time must be later than the date in vacation_start_time.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:schedule scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.
response_codes.404: • The broadcaster's schedule was not found.

name: Get Channel iCalendar
description: Gets the broadcaster’s streaming schedule as an iCalendar.
instruction: Gets the broadcaster’s streaming schedule as an iCalendar.
authorization: The Client-Id and Authorization headers are not required.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the streaming schedule you want to get.

response_body.text: The Content-Type response header is set to text/calendar.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s schedule as an iCalendar.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.

name: Get Channel Stream Schedule
description: Gets the broadcaster’s streaming schedule.
instruction: Gets the broadcaster’s streaming schedule. You can get the entire schedule or specific segments of the schedule. Learn More
authorization: Requires an app access token or user access token.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the streaming schedule you want to get.

id.instruction: The ID of the scheduled segment to return. To specify more than one segment, include the ID of each segment you want to get. For example, id=1234&id=5678. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.

start_time.instruction: The UTC date and time that identifies when in the broadcaster’s schedule to start returning segments. If not specified, the request returns segments starting after the current UTC date and time. Specify the date and time in RFC3339 format (for example, 2022-09-01T00:00:00Z).

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 25 items per page. The default is 20.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

end_time.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the broadcast ends.

canceled_until.instruction: Indicates whether the broadcaster canceled this segment of a recurring broadcast. If the broadcaster canceled this segment, this field is set to the same value that’s in the end_time field; otherwise, it’s set to null.

name: Cancel a raid
description: Cancel a pending raid.
instruction: Cancel a pending raid. You can cancel a raid at any point up until the broadcaster clicks Raid Now in the Twitch UX or the 90-second countdown expires. Rate Limit: The limit is 10 requests within a 10-minute window.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:raids scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that initiated the raid. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

response_codes.204: The pending raid was successfully canceled.
response_codes.400: • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID found in the request’s OAuth token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:raids scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.404: • The broadcaster doesn't have a pending raid to cancel.
response_codes.429: • The broadcaster exceeded the number of raid requests that they may make. The limit is 10 requests within a 10-minute window.

name: Start a raid
description: Raid another channel by sending the broadcaster’s viewers to the targeted channel.
instruction: Raid another channel by sending the broadcaster’s viewers to the targeted channel. When you call the API from a chat bot or extension, the Twitch UX pops up a window at the top of the chat room that identifies the number of viewers in the raid. The raid occurs when the broadcaster clicks Raid Now or after the 90-second countdown expires. To determine whether the raid successfully occurred, you must subscribe to the Channel Raid event. For more information, see Get notified when a raid begins. To cancel a pending raid, use the Cancel a raid endpoint. Rate Limit: The limit is 10 requests within a 10-minute window.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:raids scope.

from_broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s sending the raiding party. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

to_broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster to raid.

data.instruction: A list that contains a single object with information about the pending raid.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time, in RFC3339 format, of when the raid was requested.

is_mature.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether the channel being raided contains mature content.

response_codes.200: Successfully requested to start a raid. To determine whether the raid successfully occurred (that is, the broadcaster clicked Raid Now or the countdown expired), you must subscribe to the Channel Raid event.
response_codes.400:
• The raiding broadcaster is blocked from the targeted channel.
  • The targeted channel doesn't accept raids from this broadcaster.
  • There are too many viewers in the raiding party.
  • The IDs in from_broadcaster_id and to_broadcaster_id cannot be the same ID.
  • The ID in the from_broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
  • The ID in the to_broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in from_broadcaster_id must match the user ID found in the request’s OAuth token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:raids scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.404: • The targeted channel was not found.
response_codes.409: • The broadcaster is already in the process of raiding another channel.
response_codes.429: • The broadcaster exceeded the number of raid requests that they may make. The limit is 10 requests within a 10-minute window.

name: End Prediction
description: Locks, resolves, or cancels a Channel Points Prediction.
instruction: Locks, resolves, or cancels a Channel Points Prediction.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:predictions scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the prediction. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

id.instruction: The ID of the prediction to update.

status.instruction:
The status to set the prediction to. Possible case-sensitive values are:
  • RESOLVED — The winning outcome is determined and the Channel Points are distributed to the viewers who predicted the correct outcome.
  • CANCELED — The broadcaster is canceling the prediction and sending refunds to the participants.
  • LOCKED — The broadcaster is locking the prediction, which means viewers may no longer make predictions.
The broadcaster can update an active prediction to LOCKED, RESOLVED, or CANCELED; and update a locked prediction to RESOLVED or CANCELED.

The broadcaster has up to 24 hours after the prediction window closes to resolve the prediction. If not, Twitch sets the status to CANCELED and returns the points.

winning_outcome_id.instruction: The ID of the winning outcome. You must set this parameter if you set status to RESOLVED.

data.instruction: A list that contains the single prediction that you updated.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this prediction.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the prediction.

title.instruction: The question that the prediction asks. For example, Will I finish this entire pizza?

winning_outcome_id.instruction: The ID of the winning outcome. Is null unless status is RESOLVED.

outcomes.instruction: The list of possible outcomes for the prediction.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this outcome.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the prediction.

winning_outcome_id.instruction: The ID of the winning outcome. Is null unless status is RESOLVED.

outcomes.instruction: The list of possible outcomes for the prediction.

users.instruction: The number of unique viewers that chose this outcome.

channel_points.instruction: The number of Channel Points spent by viewers on this outcome.

top_predictors.instruction: A list of viewers who were the top predictors; otherwise, null if none.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this outcome.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the prediction.

winning_outcome_id.instruction: The ID of the winning outcome. Is null unless status is RESOLVED.

top_predictors.instruction: A list of viewers who were the top predictors; otherwise, null if none.

users.instruction: The number of unique viewers that chose this outcome.

channel_points.instruction: The number of Channel Points spent by viewers on this outcome.

user_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the viewer.

channel_points_used.instruction: The number of Channel Points the viewer spent.

channel_points_won.instruction: The number of Channel Points distributed to the viewer.

color.instruction:
The color that visually identifies this outcome in the UX. Possible values are:
  • BLUE
  • PINK
If the number of outcomes is two, the color is BLUE for the first outcome and PINK for the second outcome. If there are more than two outcomes, the color is BLUE for all outcomes.

prediction_window.instruction: The length of time (in seconds) that the prediction will run for.

status.instruction:
The prediction’s status. Valid values are:
  • ACTIVE — The Prediction is running and viewers can make predictions.
  • CANCELED — The broadcaster canceled the Prediction and refunded the Channel Points to the participants.
  • LOCKED — The broadcaster locked the Prediction, which means viewers can no longer make predictions.
  • RESOLVED — The winning outcome was determined and the Channel Points were distributed to the viewers who predicted the correct outcome.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time of when the Prediction began.

ended_at.instruction: The UTC date and time of when the Prediction ended. If status is ACTIVE, this is set to null.

locked_at.instruction: The UTC date and time of when the Prediction was locked. If status is not LOCKED, this is set to null.

response_codes.200: Successfully ended the prediction.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id field is required.
  • The id field is required.
  • The status field is required.
  • The winning_outcome_id field is required if status is RESOLVED.
  • The value in the status field is not valid.
  • To update the prediction's status to RESOLVED or CANCELED, its current status must be ACTIVE or LOCKED.
  • To update the prediction's status to LOCKED, its current status must be ACTIVE.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the OAuth token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:predictions scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.404:
• The prediction in the id field was not found.
  • The outcome in the winning_outcome_id field was not found.

name: Create Prediction
description: Create a Channel Points Prediction.
instruction:
Creates a Channel Points Prediction.
With a Channel Points Prediction, the broadcaster poses a question and viewers try to predict the outcome. The prediction runs as soon as it’s created. The broadcaster may run only one prediction at a time.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:predictions scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the prediction. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

title.instruction: The question that the broadcaster is asking. For example, Will I finish this entire pizza? The title is limited to a maximum of 45 characters.

outcomes.instruction: The list of possible outcomes that the viewers may choose from. The list must contain a minimum of 2 choices and up to a maximum of 10 choices.

title.instruction: The text of one of the outcomes that the viewer may select. The title is limited to a maximum of 25 characters.

prediction_window.instruction: The length of time (in seconds) that the prediction will run for. The minimum is 30 seconds and the maximum is 1800 seconds (30 minutes).

data.instruction: A list that contains the single prediction that you created.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this prediction.

• The broadcaster_id field is required.

  • The user access token must include the channel:read:predictions scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

name: End Poll
description: End an active poll.
instruction: Ends an active poll. You have the option to end it or end it and archive it.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:polls scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the poll. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

id.instruction: The ID of the poll to update.

status.instruction:
The status to set the poll to. Possible case-sensitive values are:
  • TERMINATED — Ends the poll before the poll is scheduled to end. The poll remains publicly visible.
  • ARCHIVED — Ends the poll before the poll is scheduled to end, and then archives it so it's no longer publicly visible.

data.instruction: A list that contains the poll that you ended.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the poll.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the poll.

title.instruction: The question that viewers are voting on. For example, What game should I play next? The title may contain a maximum of 60 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers can choose from. The list will contain a minimum of two choices and up to a maximum of five choices.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this choice.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the poll.

title.instruction: The choice’s title. The title may contain a maximum of 25 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers can choose from. The list will contain a minimum of two choices and up to a maximum of five choices.

votes.instruction: The total number of votes cast for this choice.

channel_points_votes.instruction: The number of votes cast using Channel Points.

bits_votes.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

bits_voting_enabled.instruction: Not used; will be set to false.

bits_per_vote.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

channel_points_voting_enabled.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether viewers may cast additional votes using Channel Points. For information about Channel Points, see Channel Points Guide.

channel_points_per_vote.instruction: The number of points the viewer must spend to cast one additional vote.

status.instruction:
The poll’s status. Valid values are:
  • ACTIVE — The poll is running.
  • COMPLETED — The poll ended on schedule (see the duration field).
  • TERMINATED — The poll was terminated before its scheduled end.
  • ARCHIVED — The poll has been archived and is no longer visible on the channel.
  • MODERATED — The poll was deleted.
  • INVALID — Something went wrong while determining the state.

duration.instruction: The length of time (in seconds) that the poll will run for.

started_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll began.

ended_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll ended. If status is ACTIVE, this field is set to null.

response_codes.200: Successfully ended the poll.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id field is required.
  • The id field is required.
  • The status field is required.
  • The value in the status field is not valid.
  • The poll must be active to terminate or archive it.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:polls scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header must match the client ID specified in the access token.

name: Create Poll
description: Creates a poll that viewers in the broadcaster’s channel can vote on.
instruction:
Creates a poll that viewers in the broadcaster’s channel can vote on.
The poll begins as soon as it’s created. You may run only one poll at a time.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:polls scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the poll. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

title.instruction: The question that viewers will vote on. For example, What game should I play next? The question may contain a maximum of 60 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers may choose from. The list must contain a minimum of 2 choices and up to a maximum of 5 choices.

title.instruction: One of the choices the viewer may select. The choice may contain a maximum of 25 characters.

duration.instruction: The length of time (in seconds) that the poll will run for. The minimum is 15 seconds and the maximum is 1800 seconds (30 minutes).

channel_points_voting_enabled.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether viewers may cast additional votes using Channel Points. If true, the viewer may cast more than one vote but each additional vote costs the number of Channel Points specified in channel_points_per_vote. The default is false (viewers may cast only one vote). For information about Channel Points, see Channel Points Guide.

channel_points_per_vote.instruction: The number of points that the viewer must spend to cast one additional vote. The minimum is 1 and the maximum is 1000000. Set only if ChannelPointsVotingEnabled is true.

data.instruction: A list that contains the single poll that you created.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the poll.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the poll.

title.instruction: The question that viewers are voting on. For example, What game should I play next? The title may contain a maximum of 60 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers can choose from. The list will contain a minimum of two choices and up to a maximum of five choices.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this choice.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the poll.

title.instruction: The choice’s title. The title may contain a maximum of 25 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers can choose from. The list will contain a minimum of two choices and up to a maximum of five choices.

votes.instruction: The total number of votes cast for this choice.

channel_points_votes.instruction: The number of votes cast using Channel Points.

bits_votes.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

bits_voting_enabled.instruction: Not used; will be set to false.

bits_per_vote.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

channel_points_voting_enabled.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether viewers may cast additional votes using Channel Points. For information about Channel Points, see Channel Points Guide.

channel_points_per_vote.instruction: The number of points the viewer must spend to cast one additional vote.

status.instruction:
The poll’s status. Valid values are:
  • ACTIVE — The poll is running.
  • COMPLETED — The poll ended on schedule (see the duration field).
  • TERMINATED — The poll was terminated before its scheduled end.
  • ARCHIVED — The poll has been archived and is no longer visible on the channel.
  • MODERATED — The poll was deleted.
  • INVALID — Something went wrong while determining the state.

duration.instruction: The length of time (in seconds) that the poll will run for.

started_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll began.

ended_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll ended. If status is ACTIVE, this field is set to null.

response_codes.200: Successfully created the poll.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id field is required.
  • The title field is required.
  • The choices field is required.
  • The duration field is required.
  • The value in duration is outside the allowed range of values.
  • The value in channel_points_per_vote is outside the allowed range of values.
  • The value in bits_per_vote is outside the allowed range of values.
  • The poll's title is too long.
  • The choice's title is too long.
  • The choice's title failed AutoMod checks.
  • The number of choices in the poll may not be less than 2 or greater that 5.
  • The broadcaster already has a poll that's running; you may not create another poll until the current poll completes.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token is missing the channel:manage:polls scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

name: Get Polls
description: Gets a list of polls that the broadcaster created.
instruction:
Gets a list of polls that the broadcaster created.
Polls are available for 90 days after they’re created.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:read:polls or channel:manage:polls scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that created the polls. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

id.instruction:
A list of IDs that identify the polls to return. To specify more than one ID, include this parameter for each poll you want to get. For example, id=1234&id=5678. You may specify a maximum of 20 IDs.

Specify this parameter only if you want to filter the list that the request returns. The endpoint ignores duplicate IDs and those not owned by this broadcaster.

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 20 items per page. The default is 20.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

data.instruction: A list of polls. The polls are returned in descending order of start time unless you specify IDs in the request, in which case they’re returned in the same order as you passed them in the request. The list is empty if the broadcaster hasn’t created polls.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the poll.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the poll.

title.instruction: The question that viewers are voting on. For example, What game should I play next? The title may contain a maximum of 60 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers can choose from. The list will contain a minimum of two choices and up to a maximum of five choices.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this choice.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the poll.

title.instruction: The choice’s title. The title may contain a maximum of 25 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers can choose from. The list will contain a minimum of two choices and up to a maximum of five choices.

votes.instruction: The total number of votes cast for this choice.

channel_points_votes.instruction: The number of votes cast using Channel Points.

bits_votes.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

bits_voting_enabled.instruction: Not used; will be set to false.

bits_per_vote.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

channel_points_voting_enabled.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether viewers may cast additional votes using Channel Points. For information about Channel Points, see Channel Points Guide.

channel_points_per_vote.instruction: The number of points the viewer must spend to cast one additional vote.

status.instruction:
The poll’s status. Valid values are:
  • ACTIVE — The poll is running.
  • COMPLETED — The poll ended on schedule (see the duration field).
  • TERMINATED — The poll was terminated before its scheduled end.
  • ARCHIVED — The poll has been archived and is no longer visible on the channel.
  • MODERATED — The poll was deleted.
  • INVALID — Something went wrong while determining the state.

duration.instruction: The length of time (in seconds) that the poll will run for.

started_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll began.

ended_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll ended. If status is ACTIVE, this field is set to null.

pagination.instruction: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Read More

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this choice.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the poll.

title.instruction: The choice’s title. The title may contain a maximum of 25 characters.

choices.instruction: A list of choices that viewers can choose from. The list will contain a minimum of two choices and up to a maximum of five choices.

votes.instruction: The total number of votes cast for this choice.

channel_points_votes.instruction: The number of votes cast using Channel Points.

bits_votes.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

bits_voting_enabled.instruction: Not used; will be set to false.

bits_per_vote.instruction: Not used; will be set to 0.

channel_points_voting_enabled.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether viewers may cast additional votes using Channel Points. For information about Channel Points, see Channel Points Guide.

channel_points_per_vote.instruction: The number of points the viewer must spend to cast one additional vote.

status.instruction:
The poll’s status. Valid values are:
  • ACTIVE — The poll is running.
  • COMPLETED — The poll ended on schedule (see the duration field).
  • TERMINATED — The poll was terminated before its scheduled end.
  • ARCHIVED — The poll has been archived and is no longer visible on the channel.
  • MODERATED — The poll was deleted.
  • INVALID — Something went wrong while determining the state.

duration.instruction: The length of time (in seconds) that the poll will run for.

started_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll began.

ended_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the poll ended. If status is ACTIVE, this field is set to null.

cursor.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s polls.
response_codes.400: • The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token is missing the channel:read:polls scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header must match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.404: • None of the IDs in the id query parameters were found.

name: Get Shield Mode Status
description: Gets the broadcaster’s Shield Mode activation status.
instruction: Gets the broadcaster’s Shield Mode activation status. To receive notification when the broadcaster activates and deactivates Shield Mode, subscribe to the channel.shield_mode.begin and channel.shield_mode.end subscription types.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:read:shield_mode or moderator:manage:shield_mode scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose Shield Mode activation status you want to get.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that is one of the broadcaster’s moderators. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

data.instruction: A list that contains a single object with the broadcaster’s Shield Mode status.

is_active.instruction: A Boolean value that determines whether Shield Mode is active. Is true if the broadcaster activated Shield Mode; otherwise, false.

moderator_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the moderator that last activated Shield Mode. Is an empty string if Shield Mode hasn’t been previously activated.

moderator_login.instruction: The moderator’s login name. Is an empty string if Shield Mode hasn’t been previously activated.

moderator_name.instruction: The moderator’s display name. Is an empty string if Shield Mode hasn’t been previously activated.

last_activated_at.instruction: The UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) of when Shield Mode was last activated. Is an empty string if Shield Mode hasn’t been previously activated.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s Shield Mode activation status.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:read:shield_mode or moderator:manage:shield_mode scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

name: Update Shield Mode Status
description: Activates or deactivates the broadcaster’s Shield Mode.
instruction:
Activates or deactivates the broadcaster’s Shield Mode.
Twitch’s Shield Mode feature is like a panic button that broadcasters can push to protect themselves from chat abuse coming from one or more accounts. When activated, Shield Mode applies the overrides that the broadcaster configured in the Twitch UX. If the broadcaster hasn’t configured Shield Mode, it applies default overrides.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:shield_mode scope.

is_active.instruction: A Boolean value that determines whether to activate Shield Mode. Set to true to activate Shield Mode; otherwise, false to deactivate Shield Mode.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose Shield Mode you want to activate or deactivate.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that is one of the broadcaster’s moderators. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

data.instruction: A list that contains a single object with the broadcaster’s updated Shield Mode status.

is_active.instruction: A Boolean value that determines whether Shield Mode is active. Is true if Shield Mode is active; otherwise, false.

moderator_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the moderator that last activated Shield Mode.

last_activated_at.instruction: The UTC timestamp (in RFC3339 format) of when Shield Mode was last activated.

response_codes.200: Successfully updated the broadcaster’s Shield Mode status.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
  • The is_active field is required.
  • The value in the is_active field is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:manage:shield_mode scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

name: Remove Channel VIP
description: Removes the specified user as a VIP in the broadcaster’s channel.
instruction: Removes the specified user as a VIP in the broadcaster’s channel. If the broadcaster is removing the user’s VIP status, the ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token; otherwise, if the user is removing their VIP status themselves, the ID in the user_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token. Rate Limits: The broadcaster may remove a maximum of 10 VIPs within a 10-second window.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:vips scope.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user to remove VIP status from.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster who owns the channel where the user has VIP status.

response_codes.204: Successfully removed the VIP status from the user.
response_codes.400:
• The ID in broadcaster_id is not valid.
  • The ID in user_id is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:vips scope.
  • The OAuth token is not valid.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
response_codes.403: • The user in broadcaster_id doesn't have permission to remove the user's VIP status.
response_codes.404:
• The ID in broadcaster_id was not found.
  • The ID in user_id was not found.
response_codes.422: • The user in user_id is not a VIP in the broadcaster's channel.
response_codes.429: The broadcaster exceeded the number of VIPs that they may remove within a 10-second window. See Rate Limits for this endpoint above.

name: Add Channel VIP
description: Adds the specified user as a VIP in the broadcaster’s channel.
instruction: Adds the specified user as a VIP in the broadcaster’s channel. Rate Limits: The broadcaster may add a maximum of 10 VIPs within a 10-second window.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:vips scope.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user to give VIP status to.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s adding the user as a VIP. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

response_codes.400:
• The user in the user_id query parameter is blocked from the broadcaster's channel.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter is not valid.
  • The ID in the user_id query parameter is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:vips scope.
  • The OAuth token is not valid.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
response_codes.403: • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
response_codes.404:
• The ID in broadcaster_id was not found.
  • The ID in user_id was not found.
response_codes.409: The broadcaster doesn’t have available VIP slots. Read More
response_codes.422:
• The user in user_id is a moderator. To make them a VIP, you must first remove them as a moderator (see Remove Channel Moderator).
  • The user in the user_id query parameter is already a VIP.
response_codes.425: The broadcaster must complete the Build a Community requirement before they may assign VIPs.
response_codes.429: The broadcaster exceeded the number of VIP that they may add within a 10-second window. See Rate Limits for this endpoint above.

name: Get VIPs
description: Gets a list of the broadcaster’s VIPs.
instruction: Gets a list of the broadcaster’s VIPs.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:read:vips scope. If your app also adds and removes VIP status, you can use the channel:manage:vips scope instead.

user_id.instruction: Filters the list for specific VIPs. To specify more than one user, include the user_id parameter for each user to get. For example, &user_id=1234&user_id=5678. The maximum number of IDs that you may specify is 100. Ignores the ID of those users in the list that aren’t VIPs.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose list of VIPs you want to get. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100. The default is 20.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

data.instruction: The list of VIPs. The list is empty if the broadcaster doesn’t have VIP users.

user_id.instruction: An ID that uniquely identifies the VIP user.

pagination.instruction: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Read More

user_id.instruction: An ID that uniquely identifies the VIP user.

cursor.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s list of VIPs.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The ID in the user_id query parameter is not valid.
  • The number of user_id query parameters exceeds the maximum allowed.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:read:vips or channel:manage:vips scope.
  • The OAuth token is not valid.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.

name: Remove Channel Moderator
description: Removes a moderator from the broadcaster’s chat room.
instruction: Removes a moderator from the broadcaster’s chat room. Rate Limits: The broadcaster may remove a maximum of 10 moderators within a 10-second window.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:moderators scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user to remove as a moderator from the broadcaster’s chat room.

response_codes.400:
• The ID in broadcaster_id was not found.
  • The ID in user_id was not found.
  • The user in user_id is not a moderator in the broadcaster's chat room.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:moderators scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.429: • The broadcaster has exceeded the number of requests allowed within a 10-second window. See this endpoint's rate limits.

name: Add Channel Moderator
description: Adds a moderator to the broadcaster’s chat room.
instruction: Adds a moderator to the broadcaster’s chat room. Rate Limits: The broadcaster may add a maximum of 10 moderators within a 10-second window.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:manage:moderators scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user to add as a moderator in the broadcaster’s chat room.

response_codes.400:
• The ID in broadcaster_id was not found.
  • The ID in user_id was not found.
  • The user in user_id is already a moderator in the broadcaster's chat room.
  • The user in user_id cannot become a moderator because they're banned from the channel.

• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:manage:moderators scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The ID in the broadcaster_id query parameter must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
