response_codes.429: • The broadcaster has exceeded the number of requests allowed within a 10-second window. See this endpoint's rate limits.

name: Get Moderators
description: Gets all users allowed to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room.
instruction: Gets all users allowed to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderation:read scope. If your app also adds and removes moderators, you can use the channel:manage:moderators scope instead.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose list of moderators you want to get. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

user_id.instruction:
A list of user IDs used to filter the results. To specify more than one ID, include this parameter for each moderator you want to get. For example, user_id=1234&user_id=5678. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.

The returned list includes only the users from the list who are moderators in the broadcaster’s channel. The list is returned in the same order as you specified the IDs.

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100 items per page. The default is 20.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

data.instruction: The list of moderators.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s channel.

pagination.instruction: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Read More

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s channel.

cursor.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of moderators.
response_codes.400: • The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID found in the access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderation:read scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

name: Delete Chat Messages
description: Removes a single chat message or all chat messages from the broadcaster’s chat room.
instruction: Removes a single chat message or all chat messages from the broadcaster’s chat room.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:chat_messages scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the chat room to remove messages from.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

message_id.instruction:
The ID of the message to remove. The id tag in the PRIVMSG tag contains the message’s ID. Restrictions:
  • The message must have been created within the last 6 hours.
  • The message must not belong to the broadcaster.
  • The message must not belong to another moderator.
If not specified, the request removes all messages in the broadcaster’s chat room.

response_codes.400:
• You may not delete another moderator's messages.
  • You may not delete the broadcaster's messages.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token is missing the moderator:manage:chat_messages scope.
  • The OAuth token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the OAuth token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.
response_codes.404:
• The ID in message_id was not found.
  • The specified message was created more than 6 hours ago.

name: Remove Blocked Term
description: Removes the word or phrase from the broadcaster’s list of blocked terms.
instruction: Removes the word or phrase from the broadcaster’s list of blocked terms.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:blocked_terms scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the list of blocked terms.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

id.instruction: The ID of the blocked term to remove from the broadcaster’s list of blocked terms.

response_codes.204: Successfully removed the blocked term. Also returned if the ID is not found.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The moderator_id query parameter is required.
  • The id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:manage:blocked_terms scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

name: Add Blocked Term
description: Adds a word or phrase to the broadcaster’s list of blocked terms.
instruction: Adds a word or phrase to the broadcaster’s list of blocked terms. These are the terms that the broadcaster doesn’t want used in their chat room.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:blocked_terms scope.

text.instruction:
The word or phrase to block from being used in the broadcaster’s chat room. The term must contain a minimum of 2 characters and may contain up to a maximum of 500 characters.

Terms may include a wildcard character (*). The wildcard character must appear at the beginning or end of a word or set of characters. For example, *foo or foo*.

If the blocked term already exists, the response contains the existing blocked term.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that owns the list of blocked terms.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

data.instruction: A list that contains the single blocked term that the broadcaster added.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The broadcaster that owns the list of blocked terms.

moderator_id.instruction: The moderator that blocked the word or phrase from being used in the broadcaster’s chat room.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this blocked term.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the term was blocked.

updated_at.instruction:
The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the term was updated.

When the term is added, this timestamp is the same as created_at. The timestamp changes as AutoMod continues to deny the term.

expires_at.instruction:
The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the blocked term is set to expire. After the block expires, users may use the term in the broadcaster’s chat room.

This field is null if the term was added manually or was permanently blocked by AutoMod.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of blocked terms.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The moderator_id query parameter is required.
  • The text field is required.
  • The length of the term in the text field is either too short or too long.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:manage:blocked_terms scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

name: Get Blocked Terms
description: Gets the broadcaster’s list of non-private, blocked words or phrases.
instruction: Gets the broadcaster’s list of non-private, blocked words or phrases. These are the terms that the broadcaster or moderator added manually or that were denied by AutoMod.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:read:blocked_terms or moderator:manage:blocked_terms scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose blocked terms you’re getting.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100 items per page. The default is 20.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value.

data.instruction: The list of blocked terms. The list is in descending order of when they were created (see the created_at timestamp).

broadcaster_id.instruction: The broadcaster that owns the list of blocked terms.

moderator_id.instruction: The moderator that blocked the word or phrase from being used in the broadcaster’s chat room.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this blocked term.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the term was blocked.

updated_at.instruction:
The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the term was updated.

When the term is added, this timestamp is the same as created_at. The timestamp changes as AutoMod continues to deny the term.

expires_at.instruction:
The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the blocked term is set to expire. After the block expires, users may use the term in the broadcaster’s chat room.

This field is null if the term was added manually or was permanently blocked by AutoMod.

pagination.instruction: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Read More

broadcaster_id.instruction: The broadcaster that owns the list of blocked terms.

moderator_id.instruction: The moderator that blocked the word or phrase from being used in the broadcaster’s chat room.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this blocked term.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the term was blocked.

updated_at.instruction:
The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the term was updated.

When the term is added, this timestamp is the same as created_at. The timestamp changes as AutoMod continues to deny the term.

expires_at.instruction:
The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the blocked term is set to expire. After the block expires, users may use the term in the broadcaster’s chat room.

This field is null if the term was added manually or was permanently blocked by AutoMod.

cursor.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of blocked terms.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The moderator_id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:read:blocked_terms scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

name: Unban User
description: Removes the ban or timeout that was placed on the specified user.
instruction: Removes the ban or timeout that was placed on the specified user. To ban a user, see Ban user.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:banned_users scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose chat room the user is banned from chatting in.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user to remove the ban or timeout from.

response_codes.204: Successfully removed the ban or timeout.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The moderator_id query parameter is required.
  • The user_id query parameter is required.
  • The user specified in the user_id query parameter is not banned.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:manage:banned_users scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.
response_codes.409: • You may not update the user's ban state while someone else is updating the state. For example, someone else is currently removing the ban or timeout, or they're moving the user from a timeout to a ban. Please retry your request.
response_codes.429: • The app has exceeded the number of requests it may make per minute for this broadcaster.

name: Ban User
description: Bans a user from participating in a broadcaster’s chat room or puts them in a timeout.
instruction: Bans a user from participating in the specified broadcaster’s chat room or puts them in a timeout. For information about banning or putting users in a timeout, see Ban a User and Timeout a User. If the user is currently in a timeout, you can call this endpoint to change the duration of the timeout or ban them altogether. If the user is currently banned, you cannot call this method to put them in a timeout instead. To remove a ban or end a timeout, see Unban user.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:banned_users scope.

data.instruction: Identifies the user and type of ban.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the user to ban or put in a timeout.

duration.instruction:
To ban a user indefinitely, don’t include this field.

To put a user in a timeout, include this field and specify the timeout period, in seconds. The minimum timeout is 1 second and the maximum is 1,209,600 seconds (2 weeks).

To end a user’s timeout early, set this field to 1, or use the Unban user endpoint.

reason.instruction: The reason the you’re banning the user or putting them in a timeout. The text is user defined and is limited to a maximum of 500 characters.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose chat room the user is being banned from.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

data.instruction: A list that contains the user you successfully banned or put in a timeout.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The broadcaster whose chat room the user was banned from chatting in.

moderator_id.instruction: The moderator that banned or put the user in the timeout.

user_id.instruction: The user that was banned or put in a timeout.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the ban or timeout was placed.

end_time.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the timeout will end. Is null if the user was banned instead of being put in a timeout.

response_codes.200: Successfully banned the user or placed them in a timeout.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The moderator_id query parameter is required.
  • The user_id field is required.
  • The text in the reason field is too long.
  • The value in the duration field is not valid.
  • The user specified in the user_id field may not be banned.
  • The user specified in the user_id field may not be put in a timeout.
  • The user specified in the user_id field is already banned.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:manage:banned_users scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.
response_codes.409: • You may not update the user's ban state while someone else is updating the state. For example, someone else is currently banning the user or putting them in a timeout, moving the user from a timeout to a ban, or removing the user from a ban or timeout. Please retry your request.
response_codes.429: • The app has exceeded the number of requests it may make per minute for this broadcaster.

name: Get Banned Users
description: Gets all users that the broadcaster banned or put in a timeout.
instruction: Gets all users that the broadcaster banned or put in a timeout.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderation:read or moderator:manage:banned_users scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose list of banned users you want to get. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

user_id.instruction:
A list of user IDs used to filter the results. To specify more than one ID, include this parameter for each user you want to get. For example, user_id=1234&user_id=5678. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs.

The returned list includes only those users that were banned or put in a timeout. The list is returned in the same order that you specified the IDs.

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100 items per page. The default is 20.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

before.instruction: The cursor used to get the previous page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

data.instruction: The list of users that were banned or put in a timeout.

user_id.instruction: The ID of the banned user.

expires_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the timeout expires, or an empty string if the user is permanently banned.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the user was banned.

reason.instruction: The reason the user was banned or put in a timeout if the moderator provided one.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the moderator that banned the user or put them in a timeout.

pagination.instruction: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Read More

user_id.instruction: The ID of the banned user.

expires_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the timeout expires, or an empty string if the user is permanently banned.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) of when the user was banned.

reason.instruction: The reason the user was banned or put in a timeout if the moderator provided one.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the moderator that banned the user or put them in a timeout.

cursor.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of banned users.
response_codes.400: • The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderation:read scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

name: Update AutoMod Settings
description: Updates the broadcaster’s AutoMod settings.
instruction: Updates the broadcaster’s AutoMod settings. The settings are used to automatically block inappropriate or harassing messages from appearing in the broadcaster’s chat room.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:automod_settings scope.

request_body.text: Valid values for all levels are from 0 (no filtering) through 4 (most aggressive filtering). These levels affect how aggressively AutoMod holds back messages for moderators to review before they appear in chat or are denied (not shown).

aggression.instruction: The Automod level for hostility involving aggression.

bullying.instruction: The Automod level for hostility involving name calling or insults.

disability.instruction: The Automod level for discrimination against disability.

misogyny.instruction: The Automod level for discrimination against women.

overall_level.instruction: The default AutoMod level for the broadcaster.

race_ethnicity_or_religion.instruction: The Automod level for racial discrimination.

sex_based_terms.instruction: The Automod level for sexual content.

sexuality_sex_or_gender.instruction: The AutoMod level for discrimination based on sexuality, sex, or gender.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose AutoMod settings you want to update.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

data.instruction: The list of AutoMod settings. The list contains a single object that contains all the AutoMod settings.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The broadcaster’s ID.

moderator_id.instruction: The moderator’s ID.

overall_level.instruction: The default AutoMod level for the broadcaster. This field is null if the broadcaster has set one or more of the individual settings.

disability.instruction: The Automod level for discrimination against disability.

aggression.instruction: The Automod level for hostility involving aggression.

sexuality_sex_or_gender.instruction: The AutoMod level for discrimination based on sexuality, sex, or gender.

misogyny.instruction: The Automod level for discrimination against women.

bullying.instruction: The Automod level for hostility involving name calling or insults.

race_ethnicity_or_religion.instruction: The Automod level for racial discrimination.

sex_based_terms.instruction: The Automod level for sexual content.

response_codes.200: Successfully updated the broadcaster’s AutoMod settings.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id is required.
  • The moderator_id is required.
  • The overall_level setting or one or more individual settings like aggression is required; the overall and individual settings are mutually exclusive, so don't set both.
  • The value of one or more AutoMod settings is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:manage:automod_settings scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

name: Get AutoMod Settings
description: Gets the broadcaster’s AutoMod settings.
instruction: Gets the broadcaster’s AutoMod settings. The settings are used to automatically block inappropriate or harassing messages from appearing in the broadcaster’s chat room.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:read:automod_settings scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose AutoMod settings you want to get.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

data.instruction: The list of AutoMod settings. The list contains a single object that contains all the AutoMod settings.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The broadcaster’s ID.

moderator_id.instruction: The moderator’s ID.

overall_level.instruction: The default AutoMod level for the broadcaster. This field is null if the broadcaster has set one or more of the individual settings.

disability.instruction: The Automod level for discrimination against disability.

aggression.instruction: The Automod level for hostility involving aggression.

sexuality_sex_or_gender.instruction: The AutoMod level for discrimination based on sexuality, sex, or gender.

misogyny.instruction: The Automod level for discrimination against women.

bullying.instruction: The Automod level for hostility involving name calling or insults.

race_ethnicity_or_religion.instruction: The Automod level for racial discrimination.

sex_based_terms.instruction: The Automod level for sexual content.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s AutoMod settings.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The moderator_id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in moderator_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:read:automod_settings scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in moderator_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.

name: Manage Held AutoMod Messages
description: Allow or deny the message that AutoMod flagged for review.
instruction: Allow or deny the message that AutoMod flagged for review. For information about AutoMod, see How to Use AutoMod. To get messages that AutoMod is holding for review, subscribe to the automod-queue.<moderator_id>.<channel_id>topic using PubSub. PubSub sends a notification to your app when AutoMod holds a message for review.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderator:manage:automod scope.

user_id.instruction: The moderator who is approving or denying the held message. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

msg_id.instruction: The ID of the message to allow or deny.

action.instruction:
The action to take for the message. Possible values are:
  • ALLOW
  • DENY

response_codes.204: Successfully approved or denied the message.
response_codes.400:
• The value in the action field is not valid.
  • The user_id field is required.
  • The msg_id field is required.
  • The action field is required.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in user_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderator:manage:automod scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The user in user_id is not one of the broadcaster's moderators.
response_codes.404: • The message specified in the msg_id field was not found.

name: Check AutoMod Status
description: Checks whether AutoMod would flag the specified message for review.
instruction: Checks whether AutoMod would flag the specified message for review. AutoMod is a moderation tool that holds inappropriate or harassing chat messages for moderators to review. Moderators approve or deny the messages that AutoMod flags; only approved messages are released to chat. AutoMod detects misspellings and evasive language automatically. For information about AutoMod, see How to Use AutoMod. Rate Limits: Rates are limited per channel based on the account type rather than per access token. The above limits are in addition to the standard Twitch API rate limits. The rate limit headers in the response represent the Twitch rate limits and not the above limits.
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the moderation:read scope.

data.instruction: The list of messages to check. The list must contain at least one message and may contain up to a maximum of 100 messages.

msg_id.instruction: A caller-defined ID used to correlate this message with the same message in the response.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster whose AutoMod settings and list of blocked terms are used to check the message. This ID must match the user ID in the access token.

data.instruction: The list of messages and whether Twitch would approve them for chat.

msg_id.instruction: The caller-defined ID passed in the request.

is_permitted.instruction: A Boolean value that indicates whether Twitch would approve the message for chat or hold it for moderator review or block it from chat. Is true if Twitch would approve the message; otherwise, false if Twitch would hold the message for moderator review or block it from chat.

response_codes.200: Successfully checked the messages.
response_codes.400:
• The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
  • The data field is required and the list must contain one or more messages to check.
  • The msg_id field is required.
  • The msg_text field is required.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the moderation:read scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.
response_codes.403: • The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
response_codes.429: • The broadcaster exceeded the number of chat message checks that they may make. See the endpoint's rate limits.

name: Get Hype Train Events
description: Gets information about the broadcaster’s current or most recent Hype Train event.
instruction: Gets information about the broadcaster’s current or most recent Hype Train event. Instead of polling for events, consider subscribing to Hype Train events (Begin, Progress, End).
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:read:hype_train scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the Hype Train. This ID must match the User ID in the user access token.

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100 items per page. The default is 1.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

data.instruction: The list of Hype Train events. The list is empty if the broadcaster hasn’t run a Hype Train within the last 5 days.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this event.

event_type.instruction: The type of event. The string is in the form, hypetrain.. The request returns only progress event types (i.e., hypetrain.progression).

event_timestamp.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the event occurred.

version.instruction: The version number of the definition of the event’s data. For example, the value is 1 if the data in event_data uses the first definition of the event’s data.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this Hype Train.

event_type.instruction: The type of event. The string is in the form, hypetrain.. The request returns only progress event types (i.e., hypetrain.progression).

event_timestamp.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the event occurred.

version.instruction: The version number of the definition of the event’s data. For example, the value is 1 if the data in event_data uses the first definition of the event’s data.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the Hype Train.

cooldown_end_time.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that another Hype Train can start.

expires_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the Hype Train ends.

goal.instruction: The value needed to reach the next level.

last_contribution.instruction: The most recent contribution towards the Hype Train’s goal.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this Hype Train.

event_type.instruction: The type of event. The string is in the form, hypetrain.. The request returns only progress event types (i.e., hypetrain.progression).

event_timestamp.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the event occurred.

version.instruction: The version number of the definition of the event’s data. For example, the value is 1 if the data in event_data uses the first definition of the event’s data.

last_contribution.instruction: The most recent contribution towards the Hype Train’s goal.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the Hype Train.

cooldown_end_time.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that another Hype Train can start.

expires_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the Hype Train ends.

goal.instruction: The value needed to reach the next level.

total.instruction: The total amount contributed. If type is BITS, total represents the amount of Bits used. If type is SUBS, total is 500, 1000, or 2500 to represent tier 1, 2, or 3 subscriptions, respectively.

type.instruction:
The contribution method used. Possible values are:
  • BITS — Cheering with Bits.
  • SUBS — Subscription activity like subscribing or gifting subscriptions.
  • OTHER — Covers other contribution methods not listed.

user.instruction: The ID of the user that made the contribution.

level.instruction: The highest level that the Hype Train reached (the levels are 1 through 5).

started_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that this Hype Train started.

top_contributions.instruction: The top contributors for each contribution type. For example, the top contributor using BITS (by aggregate) and the top contributor using SUBS (by count).

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this Hype Train.

event_type.instruction: The type of event. The string is in the form, hypetrain.. The request returns only progress event types (i.e., hypetrain.progression).

event_timestamp.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the event occurred.

version.instruction: The version number of the definition of the event’s data. For example, the value is 1 if the data in event_data uses the first definition of the event’s data.

last_contribution.instruction: The most recent contribution towards the Hype Train’s goal.

top_contributions.instruction: The top contributors for each contribution type. For example, the top contributor using BITS (by aggregate) and the top contributor using SUBS (by count).

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the Hype Train.

cooldown_end_time.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that another Hype Train can start.

expires_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the Hype Train ends.

goal.instruction: The value needed to reach the next level.

type.instruction:
The contribution method used. Possible values are:
  • BITS — Cheering with Bits.
  • SUBS — Subscription activity like subscribing or gifting subscriptions.
  • OTHER — Covers other contribution methods not listed.

user.instruction: The ID of the user that made the contribution.

level.instruction: The highest level that the Hype Train reached (the levels are 1 through 5).

started_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that this Hype Train started.

pagination.instruction: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Read More

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this Hype Train.

event_type.instruction: The type of event. The string is in the form, hypetrain.. The request returns only progress event types (i.e., hypetrain.progression).

event_timestamp.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the event occurred.

version.instruction: The version number of the definition of the event’s data. For example, the value is 1 if the data in event_data uses the first definition of the event’s data.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that’s running the Hype Train.

cooldown_end_time.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that another Hype Train can start.

expires_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the Hype Train ends.

goal.instruction: The value needed to reach the next level.

last_contribution.instruction: The most recent contribution towards the Hype Train’s goal.

type.instruction:
The contribution method used. Possible values are:
  • BITS — Cheering with Bits.
  • SUBS — Subscription activity like subscribing or gifting subscriptions.
  • OTHER — Covers other contribution methods not listed.

user.instruction: The ID of the user that made the contribution.

level.instruction: The highest level that the Hype Train reached (the levels are 1 through 5).

started_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that this Hype Train started.

top_contributions.instruction: The top contributors for each contribution type. For example, the top contributor using BITS (by aggregate) and the top contributor using SUBS (by count).

cursor.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after query parameter.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s Hype Train events.
response_codes.401:
• The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user_id in the user access token.
  • The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:read:hype_train scope.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

name: Update Guest Star Slot Settings
description: BETA Allows a user to update slot settings for a particular guest within a Guest Star session.
instruction: BETA Allows a user to update slot settings for a particular guest within a Guest Star session, such as allowing the user to share audio or video within the call as a host. These settings will be broadcasted to all subscribers which control their view of the guest in that slot. One or more of the optional parameters to this API can be specified at any time.
authorization:
• Query parameter moderator_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

session_id.instruction: The ID of the Guest Star session in which to update a slot’s settings.

slot_id.instruction: The slot assignment that has previously been assigned to a user.

is_audio_enabled.instruction: Flag indicating whether the slot is allowed to share their audio with the rest of the session. If false, the slot will be muted in any views containing the slot.

is_video_enabled.instruction: Flag indicating whether the slot is allowed to share their video with the rest of the session. If false, the slot will have no video shared in any views containing the slot.

is_live.instruction: Flag indicating whether the user assigned to this slot is visible/can be heard from any public subscriptions. Generally, this determines whether or not the slot is enabled in any broadcasting software integrations.

volume.instruction: Value from 0-100 that controls the audio volume for shared views containing the slot.

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Missing moderator_id
  • Missing or invalid session_id
  • Missing or invalid slot_id
response_codes.403:
• moderator_id is not a Guest Star moderator
  • The request is attempting to modify a restricted slot

name: Delete Guest Star Slot
description: BETA Allows a caller to remove a slot assignment from a user participating in an active Guest Star session.
instruction: BETA Allows a caller to remove a slot assignment from a user participating in an active Guest Star session. This revokes their access to the session immediately and disables their access to publish or subscribe to media within the session.
authorization:
• Query parameter moderator_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

session_id.instruction: The ID of the Guest Star session in which to remove the slot assignment.

guest_id.instruction: The Twitch User ID corresponding to the guest to remove from the session.

slot_id.instruction: The slot ID representing the slot assignment to remove from the session.

should_reinvite_guest.instruction: Flag signaling that the guest should be reinvited to the session, sending them back to the invite queue.

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Missing moderator_id
  • Missing or invalid session_id
  • Missing or invalid slot_id
response_codes.403:
• moderator_id is not a Guest Star moderator
  • The request is attempting to modify a restricted slot
response_codes.404: guest_id or slot_id not found

name: Update Guest Star Slot
description: BETA Allows a user to update the assigned slot for a particular user within the active Guest Star session.
instruction: BETA Allows a user to update the assigned slot for a particular user within the active Guest Star session.
authorization:
• Query parameter moderator_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user_id in the user access token.

session_id.instruction: The ID of the Guest Star session in which to update slot settings.

source_slot_id.instruction: The slot assignment previously assigned to a user.

destination_slot_id.instruction: The slot to move this user assignment to. If the destination slot is occupied, the user assigned will be swapped into source_slot_id.

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Missing or invalid session_id
  • Missing or invalid slot_id

name: Assign Guest Star Slot
description: BETA Allows a previously invited user to be assigned a slot within the active Guest Star session.
instruction: BETA Allows a previously invited user to be assigned a slot within the active Guest Star session, once that guest has indicated they are ready to join.
authorization:
• Query parameter moderator_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user_id in the user access token.

session_id.instruction: The ID of the Guest Star session in which to assign the slot.

guest_id.instruction: The Twitch User ID corresponding to the guest to assign a slot in the session. This user must already have an invite to this session, and have indicated that they are ready to join.

slot_id.instruction: The slot assignment to give to the user. Must be a numeric identifier between “1” and “N” where N is the max number of slots for the session. Max number of slots allowed for the session is reported by Get Channel Guest Star Settings.

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Missing moderator_id
  • Missing guest_id
  • Missing or invalid session_id
  • Missing or invalid slot_id
response_codes.401: moderator_id is not a guest star moderator
response_codes.403:
• Cannot assign host slot
  • Guest not invited to session
  • Guest already assigned to slot
  • Guest is not ready to join

name: Delete Guest Star Invite
description: BETA Revokes a previously sent invite for a Guest Star session.
instruction: BETA Revokes a previously sent invite for a Guest Star session.
authorization:
• Query parameter moderator_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user_id in the user access token.

session_id.instruction: The ID of the session for the invite to be revoked on behalf of the broadcaster.

guest_id.instruction: Twitch User ID for the guest to revoke the Guest Star session invite from.

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Missing session_id
  • Missing guest_id
  • Invalid session_id
response_codes.404: No invite exists for specified guest_id

name: Send Guest Star Invite
description: BETA Sends an invite to a specified guest on behalf of the broadcaster for a Guest Star session in progress.
instruction: BETA Sends an invite to a specified guest on behalf of the broadcaster for a Guest Star session in progress.
authorization:
• Query parameter moderator_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

name: Get Guest Star Invites
description: BETA Provides the caller with a list of pending invites to a Guest Star session.
instruction: BETA Provides the caller with a list of pending invites to a Guest Star session, including the invitee’s ready status while joining the waiting room.
authorization:
• Query parameter broadcaster_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:read:guest_star, channel:manage:guest_star, moderator:read:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster running the Guest Star session.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user_id in the user access token.

session_id.instruction: The session ID to query for invite status.

data.instruction: A list of invite objects describing the invited user as well as their ready status.

user_id.instruction: Twitch User ID corresponding to the invited guest

invited_at.instruction: Timestamp when this user was invited to the session.

status.instruction:
Status representing the invited user’s join state. Can be one of the following:
  • INVITED: The user has been invited to the session but has not acknowledged it.
  • ACCEPTED: The invited user has acknowledged the invite and joined the waiting room, but may still be setting up their media devices or otherwise preparing to join the call.
  • READY: The invited user has signaled they are ready to join the call from the waiting room.

is_video_enabled.instruction: Flag signaling that the invited user has chosen to disable their local video device. The user has hidden themselves, but they may choose to reveal their video feed upon joining the session.

is_audio_enabled.instruction: Flag signaling that the invited user has chosen to disable their local audio device. The user has muted themselves, but they may choose to unmute their audio feed upon joining the session.

is_video_available.instruction: Flag signaling that the invited user has a video device available for sharing.

is_audio_available.instruction: Flag signaling that the invited user has an audio device available for sharing.

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Missing session_id

name: End Guest Star Session
description: BETA Programmatically ends a Guest Star session on behalf of the broadcaster.
instruction: BETA Programmatically ends a Guest Star session on behalf of the broadcaster. Performs the same action as if the host clicked the “End Call” button in the Guest Star UI.
authorization:
• Query parameter broadcaster_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster you want to end a Guest Star session for. Provided broadcaster_id must match the user_id in the auth token.

session_id.instruction: ID for the session to end on behalf of the broadcaster.

data.instruction: Summary of the session details when the session was ended.

id.instruction: ID uniquely representing the Guest Star session.

guests.instruction: List of guests currently interacting with the Guest Star session.

slot_id.instruction:
ID representing this guest’s slot assignment.
  • Host is always in slot "0"
  • Guests are assigned the following consecutive IDs (e.g, "1", "2", "3", etc)
  • Screen Share is represented as a special guest with the ID "SCREENSHARE"
  • The identifier here matches the ID referenced in browser source links used in broadcasting software.

is_live.instruction: Flag determining whether or not the guest is visible in the browser source in the host’s streaming software.

user_id.instruction: User ID of the guest assigned to this slot.

user_display_name.instruction: Display name of the guest assigned to this slot.

user_login.instruction: Login of the guest assigned to this slot.

volume.instruction: Value from 0 to 100 representing the host’s volume setting for this guest.

assigned_at.instruction: Timestamp when this guest was assigned a slot in the session.

audio_settings.instruction: Information about the guest’s audio settings

is_host_enabled.instruction: Flag determining whether the host is allowing the guest’s video to be seen or heard within the session.

is_guest_enabled.instruction: Flag determining whether the guest is allowing their video to be transmitted to the session.

is_available.instruction: Flag determining whether the guest has an appropriate video device available to be transmitted to the session.

video_settings.instruction: Information about the guest’s video settings

response_codes.400:
• Missing or invalid broadcaster_id
  • Missing or invalid session_id
  • Session has already been ended
response_codes.403: Insufficient authorization for ending session

instruction: BETA Programmatically creates a Guest Star session on behalf of the broadcaster. Requires the broadcaster to be present in the call interface, or the call will be ended automatically.

  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster you want to create a Guest Star session for. Provided broadcaster_id must match the user_id in the auth token.

data.instruction: Summary of the session details.

id.instruction: ID uniquely representing the Guest Star session.

guests.instruction: List of guests currently interacting with the Guest Star session. On creation, the session will contain the broadcaster as a solo guest.

slot_id.instruction:
ID representing this guest’s slot assignment.
  • Host is always in slot "0"
  • Guests are assigned the following consecutive IDs (e.g, "1", "2", "3", etc)
  • Screen Share is represented as a special guest with the ID "SCREENSHARE"
  • The identifier here matches the ID referenced in browser source links used in broadcasting software.

is_live.instruction: Flag determining whether or not the guest is visible in the browser source in the host’s streaming software.

user_id.instruction: User ID of the guest assigned to this slot.

user_display_name.instruction: Display name of the guest assigned to this slot.

user_login.instruction: Login of the guest assigned to this slot.

volume.instruction: Value from 0 to 100 representing the host’s volume setting for this guest.

assigned_at.instruction: Timestamp when this guest was assigned a slot in the session.

audio_settings.instruction: Information about the guest’s audio settings

is_host_enabled.instruction: Flag determining whether the host is allowing the guest’s video to be seen or heard within the session.

is_guest_enabled.instruction: Flag determining whether the guest is allowing their video to be transmitted to the session.

is_available.instruction: Flag determining whether the guest has an appropriate video device available to be transmitted to the session.

video_settings.instruction: Information about the guest’s video settings

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Session limit reached (1 active call)
response_codes.401: Phone verification missing
response_codes.403: Insufficient authorization for creating session

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

data.instruction: Summary of the session details

guests.instruction: List of guests currently interacting with the Guest Star session.

slot_id.instruction:
ID representing this guest’s slot assignment.
  • Host is always in slot "0"
  • Guests are assigned the following consecutive IDs (e.g, "1", "2", "3", etc)
  • Screen Share is represented as a special guest with the ID "SCREENSHARE"
  • The identifier here matches the ID referenced in browser source links used in broadcasting software.

is_live.instruction: Flag determining whether or not the guest is visible in the browser source in the host’s streaming software.

user_id.instruction: User ID of the guest assigned to this slot.

user_display_name.instruction: Display name of the guest assigned to this slot.

user_login.instruction: Login of the guest assigned to this slot.

volume.instruction: Value from 0 to 100 representing the host’s volume setting for this guest.

is_host_enabled.instruction: Flag determining whether the host is allowing the guest’s video to be seen or heard within the session.

is_guest_enabled.instruction: Flag determining whether the guest is allowing their video to be transmitted to the session.

  • Missing moderator_id

name: Update Channel Guest Star Settings
description: BETA Mutates the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.
instruction: BETA Mutates the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.
authorization:
• Query parameter broadcaster_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:manage:guest_star

is_moderator_send_live_enabled.instruction: Flag determining if Guest Star moderators have access to control whether a guest is live once assigned to a slot.

slot_count.instruction: Number of slots the Guest Star call interface will allow the host to add to a call. Required to be between 1 and 6.

is_browser_source_audio_enabled.instruction: Flag determining if Browser Sources subscribed to sessions on this channel should output audio

group_layout.instruction:
This setting determines how the guests within a session should be laid out within the browser source. Can be one of the following values:
  • TILED_LAYOUT: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size.
  • SCREENSHARE_LAYOUT: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size. If there is an active screen share, it is sized larger than the other guests.
  • HORIZONTAL_LAYOUT: All live guests are arranged in a horizontal bar within the browser source
  • VERTICAL_LAYOUT: All live guests are arranged in a vertical bar within the browser source

regenerate_browser_sources.instruction: Flag determining if Guest Star should regenerate the auth token associated with the channel’s browser sources. Providing a true value for this will immediately invalidate all browser sources previously configured in your streaming software.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster you want to update Guest Star settings for.

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Invalid slot_count
  • Invalid group_layout

name: Get Channel Guest Star Settings
description: BETA Gets the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.
instruction: BETA Gets the channel settings for configuration of the Guest Star feature for a particular host.
authorization:
• Query parameter moderator_id must match the user_id in the User-Access token
  • Requires OAuth Scope: channel:read:guest_star, channel:manage:guest_star, moderator:read:guest_star or moderator:manage:guest_star

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster you want to get guest star settings for.

moderator_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster or a user that has permission to moderate the broadcaster’s chat room. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

is_moderator_send_live_enabled.instruction: Flag determining if Guest Star moderators have access to control whether a guest is live once assigned to a slot.

slot_count.instruction: Number of slots the Guest Star call interface will allow the host to add to a call. Required to be between 1 and 6.

is_browser_source_audio_enabled.instruction: Flag determining if Browser Sources subscribed to sessions on this channel should output audio

group_layout.instruction:
This setting determines how the guests within a session should be laid out within the browser source. Can be one of the following values:
  • TILED_LAYOUT: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size.
  • SCREENSHARE_LAYOUT: All live guests are tiled within the browser source with the same size. If there is an active screen share, it is sized larger than the other guests.

browser_source_token.instruction: View only token to generate browser source URLs

response_codes.400:
• Missing broadcaster_id
  • Missing moderator_id

name: Get Creator Goals
description: Gets the broadcaster’s list of active goals.
instruction: Gets the broadcaster’s list of active goals. Use this endpoint to get the current progress of each goal. Instead of polling for the progress of a goal, consider subscribing to receive notifications when a goal makes progress using the channel.goal.progress subscription type. Read More
authorization: Requires a user access token that includes the channel:read:goals scope.

broadcaster_id.instruction: The ID of the broadcaster that created the goals. This ID must match the user ID in the user access token.

data.instruction: The list of goals. The list is empty if the broadcaster hasn’t created goals.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies this goal.

broadcaster_id.instruction: An ID that identifies the broadcaster that created the goal.

type.instruction:
The type of goal. Possible values are:
  • follower — The goal is to increase followers.
  • subscription — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows the net increase or decrease in tier points associated with the subscriptions.
  • subscription_count — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows the net increase or decrease in the number of subscriptions.
  • new_subscription — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows only the net increase in tier points associated with the subscriptions (it does not account for users that unsubscribed since the goal started).
  • new_subscription_count — The goal is to increase subscriptions. This type shows only the net increase in the number of subscriptions (it does not account for users that unsubscribed since the goal started).

description.instruction: A description of the goal. Is an empty string if not specified.

current_amount.instruction:
The goal’s current value.

The goal’s type determines how this value is increased or decreased.
  • If type is follower, this field is set to the broadcaster's current number of followers. This number increases with new followers and decreases when users unfollow the broadcaster.
  • If type is subscription, this field is increased and decreased by the points value associated with the subscription tier. For example, if a tier-two subscription is worth 2 points, this field is increased or decreased by 2, not 1.
  • If type is subscription_count, this field is increased by 1 for each new subscription and decreased by 1 for each user that unsubscribes.
  • If type is new_subscription, this field is increased by the points value associated with the subscription tier. For example, if a tier-two subscription is worth 2 points, this field is increased by 2, not 1.
  • If type is new_subscription_count, this field is increased by 1 for each new subscription.

target_amount.instruction: The goal’s target value. For example, if the broadcaster has 200 followers before creating the goal, and their goal is to double that number, this field is set to 400.

created_at.instruction: The UTC date and time (in RFC3339 format) that the broadcaster created the goal.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the broadcaster’s goals.
response_codes.400: • The broadcaster_id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must contain a user access token.
  • The user access token must include the channel:read:goals scope.
  • The ID in broadcaster_id must match the user ID in the user access token.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The client ID specified in the Client-Id header does not match the client ID specified in the access token.

name: Get Games
description: Gets information about specified games.
instruction:
Gets information about specified categories or games.
You may get up to 100 categories or games by specifying their ID or name. You may specify all IDs, all names, or a combination of IDs and names. If you specify a combination of IDs and names, the total number of IDs and names must not exceed 100.
authorization: Requires an app access token or user access token.

id.instruction: The ID of the category or game to get. Include this parameter for each category or game you want to get. For example, &id=1234&id=5678. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs. The endpoint ignores duplicate and invalid IDs or IDs that weren’t found.

name.instruction: The name of the category or game to get. The name must exactly match the category’s or game’s title. Include this parameter for each category or game you want to get. For example, &name=foo&name=bar. You may specify a maximum of 100 names. The endpoint ignores duplicate names and names that weren’t found.

igdb_id.instruction: The IGDB ID of the game to get. Include this parameter for each game you want to get. For example, &igdb_id=1234&igdb_id=5678. You may specify a maximum of 100 IDs. The endpoint ignores duplicate and invalid IDs or IDs that weren’t found.

data.instruction: The list of categories and games. The list is empty if the specified categories and games weren’t found.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the category or game.

box_art_url.instruction: A URL to the category’s or game’s box art. You must replace the x placeholder with the size of image you want.

igdb_id.instruction: The ID that IGDB uses to identify this game. If the IGDB ID is not available to Twitch, this field is set to an empty string.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the specified games.
response_codes.400:
• The request must specify the id or name or igdb_id query parameter.
  • The combined number of game IDs (id and igdb_id) and game names that you specify in the request must not exceed 100.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.

name: Get Top Games
description: Gets information about all broadcasts on Twitch.
instruction: Gets information about all broadcasts on Twitch.
authorization: Requires an app access token or user access token.

first.instruction: The maximum number of items to return per page in the response. The minimum page size is 1 item per page and the maximum is 100 items per page. The default is 20.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

before.instruction: The cursor used to get the previous page of results. The Pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value. Read More

data.instruction: The list of broadcasts. The broadcasts are sorted by the number of viewers, with the most popular first.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the category or game.

box_art_url.instruction: A URL to the category’s or game’s box art. You must replace the x placeholder with the size of image you want.

igdb_id.instruction: The ID that IGDB uses to identify this game. If the IGDB ID is not available to Twitch, this field is set to an empty string.

pagination.instruction: Contains the information used to page through the list of results. The object is empty if there are no more pages left to page through. Read More

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the category or game.

box_art_url.instruction: A URL to the category’s or game’s box art. You must replace the x placeholder with the size of image you want.

igdb_id.instruction: The ID that IGDB uses to identify this game. If the IGDB ID is not available to Twitch, this field is set to an empty string.

cursor.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. Use the cursor to set the request’s after or before query parameter to get the next or previous page of results.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the list of broadcasts.
response_codes.400:
• The value in the first query parameter is not valid.
  • The cursor in the after or before query parameter is not valid.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token or user access token.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.

name: Get EventSub Subscriptions
description: Gets a list of EventSub subscriptions that the client in the access token created.
instruction: Gets a list of EventSub subscriptions that the client in the access token created.
authorization: If you use webhooks to receive events, the request must specify an app access token. The request will fail if you use a user access token.If you use WebSockets to receive events, the request must specify a user access token. The request will fail if you use an app access token. The token may include any scopes.

request_query_parameters.text: Use the status, type, and user_id query parameters to filter the list of subscriptions that are returned. The filters are mutually exclusive; the request fails if you specify more than one filter.

status.instruction:
Filter subscriptions by its status. Possible values are:
  • enabled — The subscription is enabled.
  • webhook_callback_verification_pending — The subscription is pending verification of the specified callback URL.
  • webhook_callback_verification_failed — The specified callback URL failed verification.
  • notification_failures_exceeded — The notification delivery failure rate was too high.
  • authorization_revoked — The authorization was revoked for one or more users specified in the Condition object.
  • moderator_removed — The moderator that authorized the subscription is no longer one of the broadcaster's moderators.
  • user_removed — One of the users specified in the Condition object was removed.
  • version_removed — The subscribed to subscription type and version is no longer supported.
  • websocket_disconnected — The client closed the connection.
  • websocket_failed_ping_pong — The client failed to respond to a ping message.
  • websocket_received_inbound_traffic — The client sent a non-pong message. Clients may only send pong messages (and only in response to a ping message).
  • websocket_connection_unused — The client failed to subscribe to events within the required time.
  • websocket_internal_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced an unexpected error.
  • websocket_network_timeout — The Twitch WebSocket server timed out writing the message to the client.
  • websocket_network_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced a network error writing the message to the client.

type.instruction: Filter subscriptions by subscription type. For a list of subscription types, see Subscription Types.

user_id.instruction: Filter subscriptions by user ID. The response contains subscriptions where this ID matches a user ID that you specified in the Condition object when you created the subscription.

after.instruction: The cursor used to get the next page of results. The pagination object in the response contains the cursor’s value.

data.instruction: The list of subscriptions. The list is ordered by the oldest subscription first. The list is empty if the client hasn’t created subscriptions or there are no subscriptions that match the specified filter criteria.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the subscription.

status.instruction:
The subscription’s status. The subscriber receives events only for enabled subscriptions. Possible values are:
  • enabled — The subscription is enabled.
  • webhook_callback_verification_pending — The subscription is pending verification of the specified callback URL.
  • webhook_callback_verification_failed — The specified callback URL failed verification.
  • notification_failures_exceeded — The notification delivery failure rate was too high.
  • authorization_revoked — The authorization was revoked for one or more users specified in the Condition object.
  • moderator_removed — The moderator that authorized the subscription is no longer one of the broadcaster's moderators.
  • user_removed — One of the users specified in the Condition object was removed.
  • version_removed — The subscribed to subscription type and version is no longer supported.
  • websocket_disconnected — The client closed the connection.
  • websocket_failed_ping_pong — The client failed to respond to a ping message.
  • websocket_received_inbound_traffic — The client sent a non-pong message. Clients may only send pong messages (and only in response to a ping message).
  • websocket_connection_unused — The client failed to subscribe to events within the required time.
  • websocket_internal_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced an unexpected error.
  • websocket_network_timeout — The Twitch WebSocket server timed out writing the message to the client.
  • websocket_network_error — The Twitch WebSocket server experienced a network error writing the message to the client.

condition.instruction: The subscription’s parameter values. This is a string-encoded JSON object whose contents are determined by the subscription type.

response_codes.200: Successfully retrieved the subscriptions.
response_codes.400:
• The request may specify only one filter query parameter. For example, either type or status or user_id.
  • The value in the type query parameter is not valid.
  • The value in the status query parameter is not valid.
  • The cursor specified in the after query parameter is not valid.

• The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token.
  • The access token is not valid.

name: Delete EventSub Subscription
description: Deletes an EventSub subscription.
instruction: Deletes an EventSub subscription.
authorization: If you use webhooks to receive events, the request must specify an app access token. The request will fail if you use a user access token.If you use WebSockets to receive events, the request must specify a user access token. The request will fail if you use an app access token. The token may include any scopes.

id.instruction: The ID of the subscription to delete.

response_codes.400: • The id query parameter is required.
response_codes.401:
• The Authorization header is required and must specify an app access token.
  • The access token is not valid.
  • The ID in the Client-Id header must match the client ID in the access token.
response_codes.404: • The subscription was not found.

name: Create EventSub Subscription
description: Creates an EventSub subscription.
instruction: Creates an EventSub subscription.
authorization: If you use webhooks to receive events, the request must specify an app access token. The request will fail if you use a user access token. If the subscription type requires user authorization, the user must have granted your app (client ID) permissions to receive those events before you subscribe to them. For example, to subscribe to channel.subscribe events, your app must get a user access token that includes the channel:read:subscriptions scope, which adds the required permission to your app access token’s client ID.If you use WebSockets to receive events, the request must specify a user access token. The request will fail if you use an app access token. If the subscription type requires user authorization, the token must include the required scope. However, if the subscription type doesn’t include user authorization, the token may include any scopes or no scopes.

type.instruction: The type of subscription to create. For a list of subscriptions that you can create, see Subscription Types. Set this field to the value in the Name column of the Subscription Types table.

version.instruction: The version number that identifies the definition of the subscription type that you want the response to use.

condition.instruction: A JSON object that contains the parameter values that are specific to the specified subscription type. For the object’s required and optional fields, see the subscription type’s documentation.

transport.instruction: The transport details that you want Twitch to use when sending you notifications.

method.instruction:
The transport method. Possible values are:
  • webhook
  • websocket

callback.instruction:
The callback URL where the notifications are sent. The URL must use the HTTPS protocol and port 443. See Processing an event.

Specify this field only if method is set to webhook.

NOTE: Redirects are not followed.

secret.instruction:
The secret used to verify the signature. The secret must be an ASCII string that’s a minimum of 10 characters long and a maximum of 100 characters long. For information about how the secret is used, see Verifying the event message.

Specify this field only if method is set to webhook.

session_id.instruction:
An ID that identifies the WebSocket to send notifications to. When you connect to EventSub using WebSockets, the server returns the ID in the Welcome message.

Specify this field only if method is set to websocket.

data.instruction: A list that contains the single subscription that you created.

id.instruction: An ID that identifies the subscription.

status.instruction:
The subscription’s status. The subscriber receives events only for enabled subscriptions. Possible values are:
  • enabled — The subscription is enabled.
  • webhook_callback_verification_pending — The subscription is pending verification of the specified callback URL (see Responding to a challenge request).
